pull.title: test: Flatten miniwallet array and remove random fee in longpoll
pull.body:
* Using a single MiniWallet is enough.
* A random fee isn't needed either.

rename.from: test: Log when LongpollThread is ending
rename.to: test: Log when LongpollThread is ending

events.body:
Two questions:
- Is there an example where logging the end of a thread in such a way could offer an advantage during debugging?
- Is this a good opportunity to also replace bare asserts with assertion helpers based on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/23119? The PRs that are doing that in batches seems to be not moving forward, so I was wondering if opportunistically changing them could be another way.

Based on my questions above and some comments that I left inline, I did some changes to see in practice what I was thinking. You can find them [here](https://github.com/kouloumos/bitcoin/commits/MarcoFalke-2301-test-log-%F0%9F%98%80-additions) ([diff](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/fa6a2be8eff9b67e5f6e378c2d5999981804c692...aac894dd31b5c646b7515f8918e1b42cde384871)).
Sorry, this slipped the inbox. I'll reply to the feedback

> Is there an example where logging the end of a thread in such a way could offer an advantage during debugging?

Good point. It probably doesn't. It should already be clear from the assertion being hit (or not being hit) whether the thread exited or not.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,8 +13,9 @@
 
 
 class LongpollThread(threading.Thread):
-    def __init__(self, node):
+    def __init__(self, node, log):
         threading.Thread.__init__(self)
+        self.log = log
comments.body:
Is there an advantage of passing `log` instead of 
```suggestion
        self.log = logging.getLogger('TestFramework')
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,6 +25,7 @@ def __init__(self, node):
 
     def run(self):
         self.node.getblocktemplate({'longpollid': self.longpollid, 'rules': ['segwit']})
+        self.log.info("LongpollThread ending")
comments.body:
Maybe logging the thread id could add even more value?
Something like:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18506343/215558228-a16d41da-27b3-46cb-b2a6-84b57d08f55a.png)
